metadata.subject: The case for the FC2 female condom

relationships.description: FHC provides FC2 female condoms to UNFPA for distribution
US pulled all funding from UNFPA under President Trump
European countries redirected funding to deal with migrant influx

transactions: Funding shortfall leading to stock outs

analysis.purpose: To make a business case for donor funding to address FC2 female condom stock outs in multiple countries through UNFPA
analysis.significance: Highlights global reproductive health supply chain issues and makes evidence-based case for female condom investment

notable_quotes: "The female condom is the only female initiated method that provides triple protection against STIs including HIV and Zika and against unplanned pregnancy"
"For every $1,- invested in buying female condoms in Kenya a return of $1,94 is made. In Nigeria for every $1,- invested a return of $3,20 is made"
red_flags: Global funding shortfalls for essential health commodities
Stock outs of critical HIV/STI prevention products

blackmail_indicators.description: No evidence of blackmail, coercion, or leverage tactics found

illegal_activity.description: Document is a legitimate business presentation about reproductive health products with no illegal activity

public_knowledge.context: Global health funding issues and reproductive health commodity shortages are well-documented public health topics

analysis.summary: This presentation makes a comprehensive business case for donor funding to address FC2 female condom stock outs in multiple African and Latin American countries through UNFPA, highlighting the product's triple protection benefits, cost-effectiveness, and evidence debunking common misconceptions about female condom demand and acceptability.
